titlestmt.titleproper: North Jersey Presbyterian Ministers' Monthly Society records 1802-1826
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: North Jersey Presbyterian Ministers' Monthly Society records

bioghist.p: North Jersey Presbyterian Ministers Monthly Society was a group of clergymen who met regularly to hear papers read and to hold discussions on a variety of topics. The object of the Society was the advancement of theological knowledge and ministerial usefulness.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two volumes of minutes of meetings of the North Jersey Presbyterian Ministers' Monthly Society, 1802 to 1826. The minutes record the Society's routine business, list members assigned to deliver addresses on theological topics, and list discussion questions undertaken at each meeting. The minutes include lists of moderators, secretaries, clerks, presenters, and meetings. One volume includes a docket of discussion questions.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Presbyterian Church on the Gr. (12/18/72)
